alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 09 at 1:16PM MST until January 09 at 2:15PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Gallatin County in south central Montana... * Until 215 PM MST. * At 114 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles north of Manhattan to 9 miles south of Three Forks, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Interstate 90 from Three Forks to Bozeman Pass will be impacted. Locations impacted include... Bozeman, Belgrade, Three Forks, Manhattan, Bozeman Hot Springs, Missouri Headwaters State Park, Logan, Amsterdam, Four Corners, Trident, Church Hill, Willow Creek, Menard, and Madison Buffalo Jump State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
